thread.title: Redskins Fire General Manager Scot McCloughan
thread.title_full: Redskins Fire General Manager Scot McCloughan

author: CBS Philly
title: Redskins Fire General Manager Scot McCloughan
text:
Redskins Fire General Manager Scot McCloughan March 9, 2017 7:35 PM Filed Under: NFL LANDOVER, MD - SEPTEMBER 20: General Manager Scot McCloughan of the Washington Redskins talks on the phone prior to the start of a game against the St. Louis Rams at FedExField on September 20, 2015 in Landover, Maryland. (Photo by Matt Hazlett/Getty Images) 
WASHINGTON (AP) — The Washington Redskins have fired general manager Scot McCloughan on the opening day of NFL free agency, the Associated Press reports. 
Team president Bruce Allen announced the firing Thursday night. It is effective immediately. 
McCloughan, 46, served as GM for the past two years. After Allen announced the day McCloughan was hired that the new GM would have full control over personnel decisions, there were splits in the front office on a number of issues. He did not attend the scouting combine, with a spokesman saying it was for family matters. A statement from Redskins President Bruce Allen. pic.twitter.com/7GAEXOGIvQ 
— Washington Redskins (@Redskins) March 10, 2017 
In the statement, Allen said the organization remains confident in its personnel department to execute its free agency plans and prepare for the draft. 
Allen added that the team will have no further comment on McCloughan’s departure.
